description: Human beings, and perhaps other kinds of creatures, are agents: we can make things happen. We do things intentionally, guide our behavior in light of our reasons, exhibit self-control, and plan for the future. What is it to be an agent, and what makes an event an intentional action? As Wittgenstein put the question, "What is left over if I subtract the fact that my arm goes up from the fact that I raise my arm?" Emphasis on contemporary readings, including Donald Davidson and G.E.M. Anscombe.

optimized_prerequisites.prerequisites_text: Junior standing or 3 Credits in PHILOS

prerequisites.prerequisites_text: Junior standing or 3 Credits in PHILOS
